conclusion: To determine the work done by the gas on the surroundings when transitioning from state D to state A, analyze the process using thermodynamics.
The transition from state D to state A is a horizontal line on the PV diagram, indicating constant volume (V = V1) while pressure changes from P2 to P1.
For a process at constant volume, the work done by the gas is zero because work is defined as W = P ΔV. Since ΔV = 0, the work done W = 0.
The work done by the gas on the surroundings when transitioning from state D to state A is zero.
